snippet: Sylvia Mitchell is the one accused of fraud, yet when two clients took the stand against her in criminal court, her lawyer asked them, essentially, what they had been thinking.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes court testimony of Debra Saalfield and Lee Choong, two witnesses in trial of Sylvia Mitchell, psychic who has been charged with larceny; Saalfield and Choong recount paying large sums of money to Mitchell, despite their mounting suspicions; both women say they were experiencing hard times and had no one else to talk to.
lead_paragraph: Sylvia Mitchell is the one accused of fraud, yet when two clients took the stand against her in criminal court, her lawyer asked them, essentially, what they had been thinking.

headline.print_headline: At the Trial Of a Psychic, It’s Awkward For Her Clients
headline.main: At the Trial of a Psychic, It’s Awkward for Her Clients
